items.title: Sarkozy says he will ‘sleep in jail but with head held high’ after conviction
bullets: • First time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history

• Sentence follows trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign

items.title: Swiss voters approve plan for electronic identity cards
bullets: • 50.4% of those who voted said yes to the proposal, while 49.6% rejected it
• Data will be stored only on the smartphones of individual users
• It marks the second time Swiss voters have had a nationwide vote on digital IDs

items.title: EU industry fears ever-expanding list of ‘derivative’ goods subject to steel tariffs
bullets: • US opens possibility of a rolling list of ‘derivative’ products that could be subject to tariffs
• The list includes wind turbines, mobile cranes and bulldozers
• The EU steel industry said the consultation was clearly “to expand, not to cut”

items.title: A Universal-DreamWorks movie is bringing the winning formula of kids content frenzy to the big screen
bullets: • Universal and DreamWorks Animation's "Gabby's Dollhouse: The Movie" is the latest kid's TV show to head to the box office
• It's been the most-viewed streaming original series for kids this year, according to Nielsen
• The movie follows in the footsteps of Paw Patrol and SpongeBob SquarePants

items.title: At least 40 dead in crush at political rally in India
bullets: • At least 40 dead in crush at political rally in southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu
• Victims included nine children, at least 17 women, and 13 men, officials say
• Police have filed a case against three senior members of Vijay's TVK party

items.title: US on watch as impending Tropical Storm Imelda threatens south-east
bullets: • System is forecast to become Tropical Storm Imelda later on Sunday before approaching the coast of South Carolina as a hurricane
• North Carolina governor has declared a state of emergency in advance of the system
• Meanwhile, Hurricane Humberto weakened slightly but remained a strong category 4 storm in the Atlantic

items.title: 5 takeaways from CNBC’s investigation into 'nudify' apps and sites
bullets: • A group of women in the Minneapolis area learned that a male friend used their Facebook photos mixed with artificial intelligence to create sexualized images and videos
• The discovery created emotional trauma and led the group to seek the help of a sympathetic state senator
• Because the women weren't underage and the man who created the deepfakes never distributed the content, there was no apparent crime

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: A Trump ally in California is fighting redistricting. Is that what his constituents want?
bullets: • Rep
• LaMalfa faced angry crowds at a town hall in Chico, California, in August
• Some called for his resignation, others said: 'No fascism in America' It came just days before a proposal to redraw the state’s voting map was announced

items.title: Crunch time: Democrats ready for shutdown standoff over Republican health cuts
bullets: • Democrats have refused to back President Trump’s demands to keep government funded
• They want to strip funding for foreign aid and downsize Medicaid
• The White House has threatened to shut down the federal government for the first time in six years
• Democrats have found rare leverage on the issue of health care

items.title: Deadly mass shootings take place in North Carolina, Texas and New Orleans
bullets: • Three people were killed and eight injured in a shooting in North Carolina on Saturday
• The shooting was one of several reported incidents in the state of North Carolina
• In New Orleans, one person was killed and three others injured in another shooting in New York City

items.title: A look at OpenAI's tangled web of dealmaking
bullets: • Artificial intelligence startup OpenAI is now valued at $500 billion
• The company has been inking deals worth hundreds of billions of dollars with infrastructure partners
• The Nasdaq and S&P 500 rose to record highs this week after Nvidia agreed to invest $100 billion in OpenAI

items.title: Zelensky condemns 'vile' Russian strikes lasting 12 hours
bullets: • A 12-year-old girl among those killed in 'vile' Russian aerial bombardment that lasted more than 12 hours
• Russia said it struck military facilities and industrial enterprises supporting Ukraine's armed forces
• President Volodymyr Zelensky said the deaths all occurred in the capital Kyiv

items.title: Trump is wielding the power of the state to back critical mineral companies. These are the possible next targets
bullets: • The Pentagon took an equity stake in MP Materials, the largest U.S
• rare earth miner, in July
• The White House is "not ruling out other deals with equity stakes or price floors," a White House official says
• Rare earths are key inputs in weapons platforms such as the F-35 warplane

items.title: Fruit might be the surprising key to healthier lungs
bullets: • Researchers point to antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds in fruit as possible defenses against harmful airborne particles
• The study was presented at the European Respiratory Society Congress in Amsterdam, the Netherlands
• Over 90% of the global population is exposed to air pollution levels that exceed WHO guidelines

items.title: 30 years later, I’m still obliterating planets in Master of Orion II—and you can, too
bullets: • Master of Orion II (MOO2) is a game that has you develop and build up planets across a simple galaxy map
• The deeper and longer the experience, the better the payoff can be
• The games I love the most are the ones where you make decisions that compound over many hours to a long-term payoff

items.title: 150 million-year-old pterosaur cold case has finally been solved
bullets: • Pterodactylus antiquus hatchlings were found in the Solnhofen Limestones of Germany
• Their bones showed how they had succumbed to storm winds
• Unable to fly, they drowned and were rapidly buried in the lagoon depths

items.title: Sanctions reimposed on Iran 10 years after landmark nuclear deal
bullets: • Sanctions reimposed on Iran 10 years after landmark nuclear deal was struck
• UK, France and Germany activate the so-called "snapback" mechanism
• Iran suspended inspections of its nuclear facilities in June after Israel and the US pulled out of the deal

items.title: The accidental discovery that forged the Iron Age
bullets: • The accidental discovery that forged the Iron Age reveals how ancient curiosity paved the way for one of humanity’s most transformative materials
• Researchers reanalyzed metallurgical remains from a 3,000-year-old smelting workshop in Georgia

items.title: Why “dry” oil wells aren’t really empty
bullets: • Researchers harnessed PSC's Bridges-2 supercomputer, adding a time dimension and amplitude analysis to traditional seismic data
• Their findings revealed hidden rock structures blocking oil flow, meaning reserves weren’t gone—they were trapped
• Breakthrough could lead to smarter drilling, unlocking overlooked oil and reducing waste in energy production

items.title: Maine's food pantries stare down volunteer shortage while anticipating cuts
bullets: • Phylis Allen, 78, searches for eggs at Sam's Club, cheap beets and ginger at Walmart
• Maine has long been one of the most food insecure states in New England
• Directors of food pantries say the task of making sure people are fed is getting harder because of diminishing food supplies

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Why friends are teaming up to buy homes
bullets: • Housing prices are up 56% since February 2020, according to data from the National Association of Realtors
• Hayley Currier and Tammy Kremer are longtime friends who bonded over their mutual passions for open-water swimming, Jewish rituals and political organizing

items.title: DACA has bipartisan support in Congress. Still, Republicans are following Trump's lead
bullets: • Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program created in 2012 to protect children from deportation
• Republican lawmakers are open to a permanent solution to the problem
• Nearly 20 DACA recipients have been caught in the cross-fire of the program this year
• The program has bipartisan support in Congress

items.title: Large Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10
bullets: • Large Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10 people
• A 12-year-old girl was among the dead, head of the Kyiv City Administration says
• First major bombardment since 21 killed at least 21 people last month
• Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says attack involved "nearly 500 strike drones and more than 40 missiles"

items.title: Argentines demand justice at protest against brutal killings of young women
bullets: • Two girls and two women were found dead in Buenos Aires last week
• Police say they were part of a drug-related plot to 'punish' the victims
• A video of the incident shows the victims being attacked by a gang
• The bodies of the victims were found five days after the attack

items.title: Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40
bullets: • At least 36 people are killed in a stampede at a rally in India
• The victims were trying to get close to the stage
• The incident occurred during a speech by Vijay Patel
• The crowd began to fall in the middle of the rally

items.title: Autism may be the price of human intelligence
bullets: • Specific neurons in the outer brain evolved rapidly, and autism-linked genes changed under natural selection
• These shifts may have slowed brain development in children while boosting language and cognition
• Globally, the World Health Organization estimates that around one in 100 children have autism

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: NoViolet Bulawayo wins the Best of Caine award
bullets: • Best of Caine Prize for African Writing is awarded for a short story
• The story examines the lives of a group of children in Budapest, Hungary
• The winner of the award will be announced at the end of the month
• The award was handed out at the British Library in London today

items.title: Southeast U.S. braces for heavy rains from a potential tropical storm
bullets: • Southeast U.S
• braces for heavy rains from a potential tropical storm
• Tropical Depression 9 is expected to make landfall early next week
• South Carolina Gov
• Henry McMaster put residents under a state of emergency in preparation

items.title: Cocoa supplements show surprising anti-aging potential
bullets: • Daily cocoa extract supplements reduced key inflammation markers in older adults, pointing to a role in protecting the heart
• Cocoa extract has been shown in previous, smaller studies to reduce inflammatory biomarkers
• The findings reinforce the value of flavanol-rich, plant-based foods for healthier aging

items.title: 'Seconds count': Avoiding airplane collisions at airports could come down to cockpit alerts
bullets: • Honeywell test pilot recreates some of the most serious near disasters at airports in recent aviation history
• The National Transportation Safety Board and other safety experts have urged more advanced cockpit alerts
• Runway incursions, when a plane, person or vehicle is on the runway when they shouldn't be, averaged 4.5 a day last year

items.title: The current war on science, and who’s behind it
bullets: • Michael Mann is a climate scientist at the University of Pennsylvania who, in 1998, developed the notorious hockey stick graph
• Peter Hotez is a microbiologist and pediatrician at Baylor College of Medicine whose group developed a low-cost, patent-free vaccine using public funds

items.title: Why LA Comic Con thought making an AI-powered Stan Lee hologram was a good idea
bullets: • A "AI Stan Lee hologram" will be appearing at the LA Comic Con this weekend
• Fans will be able to pay $15 to $20 to see the AI-powered avatar of Lee in an enclosed booth at the show
• The instant response from many fans and media outlets to the idea was not kind
• The CEO of the parent company behind the event urged critics to come see the hologram for themselves

items.title: ‘A donkey cart out of El Fasher costs more than a new car’: how 500 days under siege is tearing the city apart
bullets: • El Fasher, North Darfur’s capital, has been trapped in one of the longest urban sieges of modern warfare
• The siege, progressively tightened by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), has transformed the city
• Civilians move block by block in search of safety, while self-defence groups fight alongside entrenched garrisons

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: Can AI detect hedgehogs from space? Maybe if you find brambles first.
bullets: • Scientists are using satellite imagery and AI models to map hedgehog habitats across the UK
• European hedgehog populations have declined by roughly 30 to 50 percent over the past decade
• Traditional hedgehog surveys require nighttime fieldwork, specialized equipment, or citizen scientists reporting sightings

items.title: World must deny Israel ‘tools of genocide’, says growing alliance of activist states
bullets: • Malaysian foreign minister Mohamad Hasan said the international community has a legal and moral duty to deny Israel ‘the tools of genocide’ The Hague Group is a growing alliance of countries dedicated to coordinating practical economic and legal steps to isolate Israel over the war in Gaza

items.title: 'Long history of blaming mothers': Trump's Tylenol warning echoes past misconceptions
bullets: • President Trump urged pregnant women to "tough it out" and take Tylenol sparingly
• Medical experts have strongly pushed back on the guidance, arguing that such claims are misleading
• The Food and Drug Administration later clarified that "while an association between acetaminophen and autism has been described in many studies"

items.title: I spent three months with Telly, the free TV that’s always showing ads
bullets: • Free TV has a built-in screen that shows ads in the middle of the screen
• The screen stays on at all times, even if you turn off the power button
• This is the first time I've seen a free TV with ads in it, and the last few months it's free

items.title: Good news: TechWoven is fine
bullets: • Apple’s follow-up to FineWoven holds up a lot better than its predecessor
• The TechWoven case for the iPhone 17 Pro is less silky, more rugged, and much more difficult to scratch
• Apple introduced the material in 2023 when the company discontinued its leather cases and accessories

items.title: How the voice of Silksong’s Hornet brought her to life through gibberish
bullets: • The voice of Silksong’s Hornet was voiced by Makoto Koji in the original Hollow Knight
• Koji made up a lot of her own words for the character
• She says she's been surprised with how the Hollow Knight community has taken to some of the gibberish she made up

items.title: How generative AI boosters are trying to break into Hollywood
bullets: • Some of Hollywood’s biggest studios have signaled that they are ready to start riding the gen AI wave

• Even with all of the obvious concerns about copyright infringement and job displacement that generative AI presents, a steady chorus of voices has been insisting that this technology is going to be the future of filmmaking

items.title: I need a life cool enough for the new GoPro
bullets: • This week's Installer is becoming one of The Verge's subscriber-only newsletters
• In a couple of weeks, the only way to get Installer will be to subscribe to The Verge
• I’ve been reading about Lizzo and Uniqlo and book thieves and Max Verstappen, obsessing over both Black Rabbit and The Lowdown

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year

items.title: The Axe Files with David Axelrod
bullets: • The Axe Files with David Axelrod is a series of revealing interviews with key figures in the political world
• This week marks the final episode of the series of interviews with Axelrod's friend, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel
• Scott Jennings is well known as a conservative firebrand on CNN

items.title: Margins of Error
bullets: • This season on Margins of Error, Harry teases out big ideas like what accents say about where we live, how much money it takes to be happy, and whether the U.S
• should finally switch to the metric system
• Harry talks to some very smart people who are doing their best to optimize the way we travel
